item.title: The Hyatt Regency Suzhou is the inaugural Hyatt hotel in the Jiangsu province
item.description:
The Hyatt Regency Suzhou has officially opened in Suzhou, a city renowned for its historic canals, stone bridges, and UNESCO-recognized classical gardens. Source: Hyatt. The hotel boasts a 29-floor atrium, the tallest in Suzhou. “The launch of Hyatt Regency Suzhou is a significant move for Hyatt as we expand our brand presence in China,” stated Christopher Koehler, Vice President of Operations for Hyatt in China. “We aim to create valuable connections among global business and leisure travelers...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/the-hyatt-regency-suzhou-is-the-inaugural-hyatt-hotel-in-the-jiangsu-province/

item.title: Singapore remains a popular regional hub and is ranked as the fourth-most expensive city in the world
item.description:
Hong Kong is the world’s most expensive city, joined by four other Asian cities in the top 10. Chinese cities, including Shanghai (7th) and Beijing (10th), dropped in the rankings due to a weaker yuan. Singapore holds the fourth spot, while Tokyo climbed to fifth from 11th. item.title: Asia's talent and innovation are highlighted in global indices
item.description:
The Global Innovation Index (GII) 2017, a collaborative effort by Cornell University, INSEAD, and the World Intellectual Property Organization (WIPO), highlights India and Vietnam for surpassing their developmental peers. The GII, which assesses the innovative capacity of approximately 130 economies, underscores India’s emergence as a hub for innovation in Asia. This year’s GII points to a persistent disparity in innovation between developed and developing economies, alongside sluggish growth in research and development (R&D) investment from both governments and corporations...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/asia-s-talent-and-innovation-are-highlighted-in-global-indices/

item.title: The Ottomani offers a fresh and personalized dining experience with a modern twist on Middle Eastern cuisine
item.description:
The Ottomani, a new Middle Eastern supper club in Singapore, offers a unique dining experience reminiscent of a time when personalized service was paramount. The restaurant is a collaboration between The Dandy Partnership, known for bringing dining concepts like Neon Pigeon, Summerlong, and Fat Prince to Singapore, and Executive Chef Nic Philip. Chef Philip, who honed his skills at renowned London establishments such as The Clove Club (#26 on the World’s 50 Best list) and Yotam Ottolenghi’s Michelin-starred Nopi, brings his extensive expertise in Middle Eastern flavors and ingredients to Ottomani...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/the-ottomani-offers-a-fresh-and-personalized-dining-experience-with-a-modern-twist-on-middle-eastern-cuisine/
